intro: Eriospora oliveri, commonly known as the Oliver's eriospora, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are covered in fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing pale yellow to white petals. Eriospora oliveri is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in shaded, humid conditions.
